sub_title: MScT Energy Environment: Science Technology and Management (STEEM)
summary:
Graduated Applied Geophysicist turned energy transition enthusiast, I am eager to dive headfirst in the world of renewable energy. Currently pursuing the Energy Environment: Science Technology and Management (STEEM) at École Polytechnique in Paris thanks to the support of the European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT). 

With 2 applied internships and a 9 month stint at a global energy consultant under my belt, I am confident that the skill set I bring can make meaningful contributions to nearly any given endeavor. At the forefront of my interests lies renewable energy, particularly offshore energy resources (Wind, Wave and Hydrogen).

volunteer_experiences: [{'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'role': 'Student Volunteer', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Rock and Recycle - Austin City Limits', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'ENVIRONMENT', 'description': 'The purpose of this event was to raise awareness on the ever-increasing importance of recycling. During the Austin City Limits Festival, a group of my peers and I walked around the festival grounds, handing out recycling bags and talking to festival goers. In return for filling up a recycling bag with recyclable trash (cans, bottles, etc), we would hand out personalized ACL t-shirts. The event was a large success, as more than 100 60 liter recycling bags were filled, and the festival grounds were, for the majority, kept free of recyclable trash. '}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'role': 'Student Volunteer', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Riding for the Disabled Association', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEbNjnc-AnpdA/company-logo_400_400/0/1672823286698?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=3S_D3DxpBGci6H7ysn8iV9S4THhCZ2GfzgGYe39Y9P0', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/riding-for-the-disabled-association/'}, 'cause': 'CHILDREN', 'description': "It is proven that both physically and mentally impaired children thoroughly enjoy horse-back riding. However, due to their disability, they are often unable to do so without the risk of injuring themselves and/or the animal.  By leading the horse and holding the reins, a volunteer 'handler' is able to mitigate these risks. Apart from that, I was also responsible for grooming and taking care of the horse before and after riding. This activity was particularly rewarding, as I learned that I was able to improve someone's quality of life, quite visibly, with just a little bit of my time and compassion."}]
